BoutrosLab.plotting.survival 3.0.10
  • Reference

    Make a Kaplan-Meier plot by meta-dichotomizing a feature

    create.meta.prognosis.plot.Rd

    A major plotting function that takes in a meta-analytic dataset and a feature-name and outputs a survival curve based on dataset-wise median dichotomization of the feature.

    Usage

    create.meta.prognosis.plot(expression.data, survival.data, feature.name, filename,
    xlab.label = "Time (Years)", ylab.label = "Fraction of Cohort", xlimits, xat,
    label.times, label.positions, label.cex = 1.2, main = NULL, main.cex = 3.0,
    rounding = 2, covariates = NULL, line.colours = c("blue", "red"), resolution = 2000,
    enable.warnings = FALSE, description = NULL);

    Arguments

    expression.data

    A list of matrices, with each list element representing an expression matrix for a separate dataset

    survival.data

    A list of survival objects, with each list element representing a survobj for a separate dataset

    feature.name

    The name of the feature to be dichotomized

    filename

    The filename to be written

    xlab.label

    X Axis Title. Defaults to 'Time (Years)'

    ylab.label

    Y Axis Title. Defaults to 'Fraction of Cohort'

    xlimits

    The limits of the x (time) axis

    xat

    The locations of the x-axis labels

    label.times

    A vector of times at which to calculate the fraction of patients still at risk

    label.positions

    A vector of positions at which to print the fraction of patients still at risk

    label.cex

    Size of patients at risk text

    main

    The main title for the plot (space is reclaimed if NULL)

    main.cex

    Size of text for main plot title

    rounding

    How many decimal places of precision should be shown in printed survival statistics?

    covariates

    A data-frame (or matrix?) of variables to be controlled in the Cox model. If null, no adjustment is done. No interactions are fit.

    line.colours

    A vector of colours to be used in plotting

    resolution

    Figure resolution, defaults to 2000

    enable.warnings

    Print warnings if set to TRUE, defaults to FALSE

    description

    Short description of image/plot, defaults to NULL

    Value

    Returns a survival curve (written to file) and a four-element vector containing the survival results.

    Author

    Paul C. Boutros

    See also

    make.survfit.plot, make.survival.plot

    Examples

     # add examples
